chargen.label: Aspects
chargen.instruction: An aspect is a word, phrase, or sentence that describes something centrally important to your character. It can be a motto your character lives by, a personality quirk, a description of a relationship you have with another character, an important possession or bit of equipment your character has, or any other part of your character that is vitally important.

help.text: Agendas are a type of secret charcter aspect that represents something hidden aabout you -- an ulterior motive, a power you've been keeping secret, or something else you'd want to keep hidden.
Concept sums up your character's deal in one short phrase. It's how you deal with problems and the source of most of them.
Your Talent aspect is a specific skill, hobby, or occupation that your character is great at.

Your Student aspect describes something important about your place in the Academy - a subject you're good at, a reputation with your classmates, a specific relationship with a student or teacher, and more.
Your Drive aspect is something that motivates most of your character's actions, like curiosity, a need for recognition, a terrible fear, a best friend, a worst enemy, or something else.

chargen.label: Approaches
chargen.instruction: Approaches are descriptions of how you accomplish tasks. Everyone has the same six approaches, and each is rated with a bonus that's applied when you roll to attempt some related task. Choose one at Good (+3), two at Fair (+2), two at Average (+1), and one at Mediocre (+0).

chargen.label: Stunts
chargen.instruction: A stunt is a special trait that changes the way an approach works for your character. Generally, stunts give you a bonus to a certain approach when used with a particular action under specific circumstances. You can start with up to three, and can gain more as your character advances.
